text.text_translated: There are more questions about how genetics influenced the development of our brains and language. For example, did a change in a **gene** give us the ability to speak? A **gene** is a part of our DNA that controls how we grow. Researchers have found a specific genetic change that occurred between 200,000 and 100,000 years ago, which seems to be linked to speaking and how our brains control our mouths and faces. Although monkeys have a similar gene, it did not develop in the same way. It is too early to say how much influence genes have on language, but one day the answers might be found in our DNA.
